text: Really, really good house salsa. Beef flautas and sweet corn tamal were outstanding. And excellent service.

I had the shrimp Enchiladas. I asked the server what it came with, he said rice and arugula salad. There was no rice just the salad and a lot of sauce that was really sweet. They should describe what comes in the plate on the menu. I could've done without the sweetness. Flavorful, but not the best I've had. Guacamole was okay. Chips were my favorite part. They were delicious and crispy. A little salty. The mango mousse was also extremely delicious. Highly recommend. Might come back but will stay away from the shrimp enchiladas.

I am absolutely in love with Olivia's.. Great service and beautiful environment to dine in... I ate the tostada's and they were so delicious. I will definitely be a returning customer.. I can't wait to try more of the authentic dishes here. 5 stars for sure!!!

The food here is fantastic and delicious rooting down even to the chips and salsa. The place looks really nice and the ambience is good. The service there is attentive and amicable. They have no problem if you want to alter the order, they'll make it happen. Overall this place is highly recommendable.

Great experience. First time checking it out and we will be back. Service was awesome - specifically Rolando took our order and him and his team were very attentive! Nice to have a reliable place in the neighborhood.

Terrible experience - appeared to be waiters first day.  Delay in reception, drinks, refills etc. Manager jumped in (said rolling out a new system was his excuse) but he continued to forget some of the items we were missing. Party of 7 had 2 eat separately since some meals were missed and wrong.  Manager provide his apologies and $80 in GC's, waived some items but would not pay to come back here.  Food was mediocre to boot - would pass. Only pro - decent margaritas.

I'm glad to see  the new mall owners are trying to make the Boulevard Mall a nice place again and Olvia's is a new, slightly upscale restaurant with unique food choices. You can enter from the street or inside the mall. Back in the day, there were a few restaurants in front of the mall. The Vineyard, which was one of the first buffets I've been to, as well as Panda Inn, which was the parent of Panda Express. But I digress... The drinks are limited and only two kinds of margarita: regular and cadillac which was $5 more. At least make the float of Grand Marnier visible on top or serve in a sidecar. Not a big difference between the two. Tacos are served during lunch only. We started out with guacamole. It was very fresh but could have used more seasoning. The salsa was fresh as well and was spiced well. I ordered the scallops. The whole dish, including the rice with corn, cilantro, chicharrones (I think) was seasoned perfectly. The scallops were large and juicy, cooked perfectly. Not to too spicy, but did have a nice kick. There was nothing left on the plate, not one piece of rice or kernel of  corn, it was that good. My friend had the swordfish, grilled and seasoned perfectly. It rested on top a sweet potato mash that was a great accompaniment to the meaty piece of fish. Next time I will try the ox tail enchiladas.

This place has an awesome ambiance, with a great and friendly staff. The food and cocktails are fresh and beautifully made. The menu comes with a large variety of traditional food from different countries, with a modern gourmet twist.

Went to this restaurant last Friday 1/6/17 assuming it would be a great experience and good food based on the previous reviews. We were seated right away and a server brought us chips and salsa within a few minutes. He stated that our server would be right with us. 15-20 minutes later our server still had not been to our table to even take our drink order. Meanwhile a couple next to us had been seated after us and received their drinks (different server).  I was very disappointed, if a server is busy it's good customer service to at least acknowledge your new table but that wasn't even done. We left and went to Lindo where the service is always excellent.

Worst Vegas dining experience. Rip off, poor food and service. Restaurant located inside an unsafe failing shopping mall, 3 time change in management, they don't honor their gift certificates. My car was broken into in broad day light and my girlfriend who works there was mugged in the parking lot. Stay away from this area. I've lived here 10 years.

So my wife and I had been hearing about this place so we decided to stop by after doing some shopping at the Boulevard Mall. The service and food was great!!! but was even better was the specials. They featured  $3 Enchiladas (I recommend)
$3 Tacos, $3 Tostadas and $1 Beer!!! So if you are looking for some great food and service stop by Olivia's

It was our first time going here and everything that we ordered was very delicious and the service was excellent.The waiter was very kind and made good conversation with us. The prices were reasonable and I recommend this restaurant who seek new places to eat.
The presentation and the pricing was good, but the amount of time it took for everything was horrible. The waiter tried, he really did. Wasn't his fault that the restaurant was understaffed.

The response to my review is EMBARRASSING! I never attempted to combine any promotions and placing the blame on the former management is ridiculous. Learn how to treat customers and whenever things go wrong, give a genuine apology and offer to correct the situation. SHADY MANAGEMENT!

I'm in town with my family from Los Angeles, CA, and I am glad I found this place. The food was great, and the service was excellent.  I had the shrimp tacos (and coming from a place with great fish tacos), Olivia's fish tacos far exceeded my expectations. Overall, my family and I had a great experience. I highly recommend this place.

What a hidden gem. Tucked away in a not so new side of town in the boulevard mall this place aims to please! Service was wonderful and very helpful. Our waiter was able to give us information on the establishment and food. The food came out just like the pictures on Yelp. The fish tacos are to die for!!

I will be back to support this place for sure!!
Would have loved to review, but the place was closed on a Friday night.

So I'm usually not a fan of giving too many stars to a new restaurant. Of course they're going to be good, everyone's still motivated to make it great!

However, the food is the reason for the four stars.

My husband and I went to try Olivia's because he literally happened upon the place; it was political night though. There was an event, HIP. I'm all for politics, just not when I'm dining. We stayed though. There were three bartenders and the restaurant manager (an assumption) behind the bar, where we decided to sit and dine. They were all extremely attentive probably because they still wanted to make sure their regular patrons were getting tended to. I never had an empty drink!!

Now for the food, my favorite part. Husband got steak tacos, I got oxtail enchiladas. Both so incredible! Everything is fresh. Their verse sauce is homemade and the most delectable I've had so far in the Vegas valley. The oxtail meat was rich, however, a little greasy. Not bad though.

My husband's steak tacos must have been good because he didn't let me try any of them. The chunks of meat were size able for the small tacos. Overall, I'll go back. Minus the politics though.
I love authentic paella and this place didn't disappoint!!! From start to finish my experience here was wonderful!!! Thank you

Yesterday was our fourth visit,  Everything was different.  There were no more spicy dishes on the menu.  Beer menu was different.  Portions were smaller.  Prices were higher.  The bartender did a very fine job of trying to explain why the octopus was no longer on the menu although the prior visits they told us it was most popular,  They said it was a mistake and we could still get the dish,  The great thing was the dish was very spicy and delicious.  Now it was bland as a bowl of oats,  When we asked the manager he was condescending and pretty much undid everything the bartender did to meet our needs.  He was insulting and told us people complain about spicy and if we wanted it spicy we should have specifically told the cook that,  Well we ordered an item not on the menu that we had before that was spicy.... pardon me that we did not think to mention to the chef we wanted it the way it was before.  
The menu has changed repeatedly in the short time they have been open.  We thought this would be a place we liked and frequented but everything that made it special has been removed from the menu and I am not interested in being insulted by the manager again.  He actually acted annoyed and angry that we asked about the old menu.
Too bad.  Another place off our list.  Sad.

I picked this place for my mom's birthday dinner and overall it was a solid pick!! From the moment we stepped into the restaurant, the service was superb! We were greeted by friendly staff and they accommodated our every need. They were extremely attentive and easy-going!! The atmosphere was great. They played lively and up-beat music to set the tone of the restaurant. The place is clean, spacious and decorated fabulously! Our server was ROLANDO, such an amazing guy. He's knowledgeable of the entire menu and made us feel like home. Service was fast especially for a party of 8. Food was delicious. Fresh ingredients and flavors were ON POINT!! We ordered a lot and none of the dishes disappointed. This place is outstanding and I HIGHLY recommend. My family and I will definitely come back

DO NOT WASTE YOUR HARD WORKING MONEY HERE. By far the worst experience I've had in a while. Food okay typical Mexican taste nothing special, only difference is staff doesn't know what they are doing they ran around the restaurant looking helpless, while 3 managers walk around just looking pretty ? Hostess sat me in a dirty table and instead of getting it clean the busser asked me directly if I wanted a dirty table ? Lol that was a shock ! 
Then waiter comes in running asking me "what do you want to drink" 
Without introducing her self without a greet complete awkwardness. It took her 10 min to get my drinks and 25-30 to get our food but of course she got my order wrong ! 
This place was an absolute joke ! 
Manager said I would get a discount for inconvenience ( 20% off ) how about actually helping your servers or making sure your bussers aren't being rude. 
People go else where ! Perhaps El Dorado Cantina they are all non GMO organic lol.

If you're a LV visitor and don't spend $5 to Uber to this place then you deserve what you get (high prices and horrible service)on the Strip. If you're a local and scared of the Boulevard Mall, then go back to Summerlin and have a generic dinner at Cantina Laredo. 

Olivia's  is super cool inside--happy hour is the best deal in LV. Bartenders Eric and Oscar are chill and know what they're doing. Food is A+

hey, its good. showed up late from my team. they told me the food takes a bit since im late. ok ill order to go. it still came out in time for me to eat. 

drinks are great food is awesome quality, prices are great. 
The guac was not included. in any meal. on table of 8 where theres 8 check s. the manager came down gave us 20 percent off and waved the guac fees because we didnt know. 

the atmosphere is great, food is great, prices are good and customer service is good. you do not have to wait to be attended to. review left at lunch on friday
As a local I recommend this place hands down, great service awesome food full of flavor, drinks that make you go down the list just to try every single one.

This place is amazing, the food was unexpectedly refreshing, really flavorful. Our server, Rolando was very knowledgeable about the food as well as very friendly. The atmosphere was very upbeat but at the same time it was classy.

This place is AMAZING. I finally found an awesome Latin restaurant! Everything was outstanding from the service to the food. We ordered the Grilled Calamari, Ahi Ceviche, and the Fish Tacos. Everything tasted gorgeous. Flavors were out of this world. I will definitely be a regular here. I can't wait to come back and try all the other dishes! :)

This restaurant has great atmosphere. The service is good and food was excellent. If you don't really like spicey then pass on the calamari. Over all prices are good for good pricey for cocktails. Check it out.

Wow...what a Gem!
I trully have so much to say of Olivia's Restaurant...just a few miles away from the Las vegas Boulevard...u wont regret it at...not ONLY their the nicest people...service is great their personnel are very attentive and willing to help u choose an amazing plate of food...my husband and i went to 2 dif mexican restaurant highin and food was ok...but once the check comes it becomes a stress and is just ur first nite in...but when u GO to Olivia's...not ONLY tge food is Outstanding and i must add delish....the price is a bargain...and when u compare the flavors with the other restaurant truly no comparison...thats how amazing it is...we had tongue tacos...and the meat was so sooo tender and flavorful...it melts in ur mouth wow...no words...ans my husband had a burrito and the green tomatillo  sauce is to die for! We also had one of our most delightful  and fresh guacamole...EVEEeeeeer...and we've  had our share of guacamoles....but this one was one of our fav indeed!!!  Ohhh and u must try the Horchata Authentic Berverage...ummmm...i just wish i can have one rite NOW i totally gave it a 5 star and recommend it  to all of u readers...YOU wont regret it!!!

First time so I tried the Oxtail Enchiladas. My husband had the seafood stew and a side of rice. Love the rice. We also had the calamari for our appetizer.  We sat  at the bar so we could watch the 10 TV's. Eric served us at the bar. Service was excellent. We will be back

We happened to be at the Mall and popped into this restaurant. Very clean, great service and great prices. The chicken quesadilla was awesome and the beef tacos and the guacamole were really good too. we were visiting from California.

Everything was delicious, especially the shrimp tostada. The quesadillas were yummy. For desserts we tried the mango mousse and chocolate cake .The location is beautiful in the newly remodeled Boulevard Mall. There are two entrances , one from the street, and one from the mall so it's easy to access. 

There is a beautiful, large bar that is the centerpiece of the modern and fast paced restaurant.

Went here with a group. The food was great. The staff was attentive and friendly. The owner greeted us and invited it back. Everyone had a fun time. I had one of the best Cubano Tortas I have ever had.  I will return.
Definitely will recommend, great food, great location! This is better than Lindo Michoacan!

Loved this place! Came here with my husband and two of our friends. food was delicious and great presentation. We also ordered a few cocktails, mojitos were my favorite,  the bartender made them  really good so we had a couple each. The service was great. Overall we had a great time, left happy, with full tummys. We would have stayed longer and buy more drinks,  but it was past 10pm closing  time so it was time to go. I would say I would come back again and bring all my friends. Beautiful place,  Great service, good food, good drinks.

I have subtly anticipated the opening of this place for some time. I should preface this with the fact that I have eaten at almost every 5 star place in this town. Personally and on business with clients. 
The sheer gumption of the location only amplifies my likeness of what is being done with this restaurant. 
The ascetic and ambience is a understated elegance. Clean lines and muted tones. The craft cocktails are brilliantly done, truly! I can't say this next line emphatically enough, the service is truly as good as you are going to find in absolutely any fine dining setting! Brilliant etiquette and attention to detail! 
Pupusas de chicharron is what were started with. Great flavor without being overwhelming. Perfectly executed and a wonderful segway to the entree. Very important to not dominate the dining experience with the appetizer. The star is the entree. 
Seared scallops and lechon asado with bitter greens and a sweet vinaigrette. The scallops were plated with a yellow rice. The scallops were amazing! Just as good as if I pulled them from the Chesapeake Bay myself! The pork shoulder was was elevated. Very tender with sweet pickled vegetables and guacamole. The wonderful composition of combining flavors from all over Latin America and marrying them together in very creative ways is not only creative but a breath of fresh air not only to the palette but to the area. 
Bravo on all fronts.. I will be back, with company.
Please share as much as possible! This place is worth the experience!

First off the salsa needs to be jarred and sold! It is amazing! Treasure was our chip and salsa guy and was very on top of everything! Kept our chips full! We had the home made guacamole which was also amazing! We started with Some mussels which were average but I'm a mussel snob so I wasn't too impressed! I got the garlic shrimp by the recommendation of Rolando! What a great recommendation! It was so good! And they definitely don't make you search for the shrimp! Huge portion of shrimp with perfectly portioned sides. The rice was slightly over cooked in some spots but was otherwise an amazing companion to the shrimp and the slices of fresh garlic were very impressive! Overall amazing flavors, great service and a must visit spot in Vegas! Thank you Treasure and Ronaldo for a great experience!
I went for lunch today and got tacos . Food was delicious . Staff was very attentive and price was very reasonable . Very nice clean dining area as well .
El restaurante muy fino y bonito, el servicio del personal muy bueno y la comida exquisita,  el único pero,  que quizá los platos no son muy grandes,  teniendo en cuenta que en USA,  SÍ SUELEN SERLO

DELICIOUS!!!!! Thank you Rolando for the service. The food is amazing, we never had an empty glass! I had the chicken enchiladas and WOW do thy melt in your mouth, rice had white corn in it and I also had black beans with my plate, which was also amazing! We will definitely be back.

Men thinking with their wiener.
Instead of their taste buds....

The answer to why this place gets good stars.

Girls: it's cold, the food is o.k. Wear leg warmers and a sweater. 
Guys, you'll love it, the girls are young and wear short skirts with cleavage.


See my original review to get more words describing me the same thing.
Great food, outstanding service. The burritos are huge. Great place we picked it last minute on yelp as we were leaving Cowboy Christmas. Happy we did.

The food is so crafted carefully and delish!  They bring you yummy chips with parmesan cheese and Chipotle salsa! We ordered the steak burrito for $10 it was huge.  Also, they have $3 chicken enchiladas with tasty Tomatillo salsa, ceviche tostadas, and street tacos.  Very good and worth it.

This is a Mexican Restaurant inside the Boulevard Mall...its usually empty when I come by, decided to try it today.  Chips and Salsa were good.

I ordered the chicken enchiladas (2) which came with black beans and corn rice...they were delicious, i could taste the Oaxaca cheese...

my friend ordered the Shrimp enchiladas (2)which came with a delicious but different brandy sauce , pinto beans and corn rice... he mixed some of his rice with the sauce, he was definitely satisfied..


Piña Colada was ok...it looked different than the one the advertised  

we'll definitely be back to explore the menu

Great hidden gem! Fancy atmosphere and food of a high end restaurant you wouldn't expect in a mall...without the prices. Great menu selection for most tastebuds. Waitstaff was pretty damn good too. Attentive and nice. 
I'll be back!

We had dinner here on Tuesday, we are visiting from Los Angeles. The restaurant is part of a mall - the inside is clean and nice. It was not full and yet it took our waiter a couple minutes to help us and we had to waive him down ! The food looks really good but it really lacks seasoning and flavor . The chips and salsa were probably the best thing ! I had chicken enchiladas with rice and beans . The enchiladas were good but the rice and beans were bland . I think their prices are too high! I would not recommend or return to this restaurant

Very good food and great service. Maria was a great server. The chips and salsa are really really good. 
I will definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood
This is a great new addition to the Boulevard Mall great atmosphere, tvs, bartenders and staff are attentive and the chef makes a point to come meet you! Awesome happy hour too..

Food was great! Service was excellent. 
We ordered Shrimp Diablo, shrimp enchilada. The corn tamale was the bomb!!! Rolando  made good suggestions. We ordered everything he recommended.

Ok, so I'm a little behind on posting this but I could not let this go as I overheard someone thinking about trying this establishment. I would like to concentrate on that word for a second ( at least in the business context). This is a new company trying to " establish " themselves so i would think they would do what they could to ensure customers return multiple times and more important, pass the word on so more patrons would visit their business in the future.  I came here during my lunch hour two weeks ago with some co-workers. We were sat immediately as it was not busy at all. We were originally sat at a booth and we asked to transfer to a table. We were accommodated and ordered our drinks. Our order was also taken very promptly. There were four of us there. We all ordered enchiladas ( three chicken and one shrimp if that matters ). I also ordered the fideo soup. Our server brought the soup within five minutes. I tasted it and did not enjoy it as it was not the fideo soup i am accustomed to. The server asked if there was a problem with the soup and I explained it was just not what i expected and he said he would remove it from the tab. I explained that was appreciated but unnecessary. I ordered it and didn't like it, and that was not their fault. He said not to worry about it. He would take care of it. So far so good but then the bad started to happen. We are now 20 minutes in and still have not received our meals. As the server walked by we asked him how much longer. He stated " it is coming out right now. We make the food fresh so it takes a little longer " . They proceeded to sit a table of eight and took their order. Another 10 minutes and still no food. They brought out a dish but it was not our order. He apologized and said he would be right back with our food. In the meantime, the table of eight received their food. Our server passed by three more times ( each time stating the food would be right out ) and the last time was as we were getting up to leave. He said it would be a ready in a second. I then said that our lunch hour was over. We started towards the door and saw that the server was complaining to the manager. He motioned towards us and they began to walk our direction. We paused at the door. I was then caught off guard as I was expecting an apology and maybe a " ask for me and i will give you a discount at your next visit" comment or at the very least an apology for wasting our time. The manager then looked directly at me and paused. I assumed he was waiting for a complaint but all i said was we have to leave because our lunch hour is over. He then shocked us all with a sarcastic remark stating " What? Do you want an umbrella or something" ( It was obviously raining that day )? We were all very surprised and left at that point. It is a shame because we were all very excited about trying this new option for lunch as we work close by. I cannot comment about the quality of food as we never received anything other than the soup. They did not even ask if we wanted to take the food to go as it was probably still not ready. If you decide to give this place a try, I recommend making sure you're not on a time crunch.

This place is a joke. Seriously, if you order a meal that comes with pico, and you want more, they literally charge you for it. The salsa tastes and looks like it was filtered through a sweaty tube sock.  They don't have any other types of salsa just the one. Even the Manager Frank is a douche canoe. He walks around with a holier than thou attitude wearing a jacket that can only be sported by Hugh Hefner if he wore burlap sacks. When he came by asking if everything was okay, we voiced the pico problem and he told us that "it is what it is" and told us not to come back!  We seriously were so disgusted by this place that we didn't even finish our meals. About the only thing that was worth their weight in nasty salsa was Maria, our waitress. She tried her best to make us happy but ultimately, when your hands are tied by a crap manager and crap food, you're not going to be able to do much. We actually felt sorry for her. Nobody should have to work in those conditions. She is sweeter than cotton candy and deserves more than a raise. Maria, if you are reading this, we salute you. If you as a consumer choose to patronize this establishment, do yourself a favor and ask for Maria as a waitress and don't blame me for the rest of the crap you get.
Great authentic flavor with a modern twist oxtail is amazing . Pork shoulder mouthwatering . As a chef I recommend it

More of a Latin Cuisine than Mexican. I had Chicken Tostado Salad and my husband had Chicken Quesadillas. Both were good and the price was great. Staff was very friendly. Upbeat music and lots of TVs throughout make for a lively atmosphere. Very nice experience.

This is an amazing restaurant with an even better bar! Central location - close to UNLV, downtown, and the strip. I've tried 8 items on the menu and everything is delicious. Huge portions for the price. Happy hour deals are beyond worth it. And the local bartender, Erica, is smart, funny, a joy to talk to, and one of the best bar tenders I've met in Vegas.
Amazing place to eat food is delicious!!! The atmosphere is great and the service was fantastic!! We order shrimp a la diabla and al Mojo de ajo!! I completely recommend it.

I paid this wonderful restaurant a visit Friday afternoon.  The hostess confirmed my reservation and showed me to my table.  My server was Alberto (yeah he was cute). He brought over some delicious, warm, tortilla chips and mild salsa (fresh made I am sure), I had already perused the menu and ordered up Oysters on the Half Shell for my appetizer.  All I can say is YUM, these shellfish were buttery good, served with lime wedges and a spicy little sauce. My entrée were the Pork tacos, also DE-LISH!  Served with Black Beans and rice, the Tacos had fresh Cilantro and onions to bring out the flavor of the meat. The servers are prompt and the service was top-notch.


 I am looking forward to visiting Olivia's again in the near future.

As a last minute decision, a local friend of mine suggested we go there for dinner. We made a reservation, even though we didn't need it. The wait staff is fantastic. It's seriously some of the best services I've gotten anywhere in the country. The food is delicious. I'm always skeptical about seafood far away from the coast, but it was really good. The prices were reasonable for a dinner menu heavily focused on seafood. There's a good amount of spice in the food, which I find delicious, but if you're hesitant about spice, make sure you let them know. I definitely look forward to another visit to Las Vegas so I can stop here again. Oh! And leave room for the Mango Mousse!
Came during happy hour and all drinks poured were only 3/4 full. Food service was terribly slow at the bar but the food was good. I would give the food 4 stars but service at the bar is awful.

When this place opened it was the bomb. Now not so much. It's food and quality has gone down immensely. Would we come here again, most likely not. Must be that the chef has changed. Whereas the food was fresh and exciting, is now the same as any other restaurant on the corner. We staff used to be very attentive and salacious, now you have to flag them down for everything. I wish them well in the future and I hope they come back to their opening day glory but I am not hopeful.

I really wanted to like this place but the service was just not there and there were a few food issues. Our best part of the experience was the first 5 minutes and it was downhill from there. We were greeted and seated and  immediately brought chips and salsa. From there, it took almost ten minutes for a server to get our drink order (after we asked for a drink menu) and we didn't get drinks for a full 5 minutes after that. The food was extremely slow coming out. My skirt steak with chimichurri had been cut into and looked pretty bad. The chimichurri was more of decoration than a flavor for the steak. My boyfriends chicken tacos had brown avocado slices on them and his rice was cold. Our second round of margaritas came at the end of our meal as well. The service just wasn't up to par for an $80 meal.

The guacamole was awesome. Great happy hour 7 to close. Beans and rice were cold. Pork tacos and garlic shrimp were good. Poor service. I called and made reservations and i said we were celebrating my cousins bday. When we walked in and i reminded them it was my cousin's bday. Waiter came up to take orders and again stated it was my cousin's bday. Thr checks came and i reminded the waiter again. We got a piece of cake which was good. Good happy hour place. Not bday place.

Great food! The salsa was perfect! The chicken tacos were amazing! I love the melted cheese between the two tortillas. We will definitely be coming back. The staff was pleasant and attentive. The manager and chef came to our table and were very genuine. Can't wait to try more menu items!

We went in on Sunday no one was in the resturant. The hostess sat us immediately and was very nice. Our server was very nice. We ordered the guacamole to start it was VERY good tasted very fresh just needed some salt. We also ordered the Nachos, elote, a cheese enchilada and tortilla soup. The food was great it was all hot and had good flavor. I just wasn't very impressed with the menu set up. I feel like everything I wanted was all side dishes or appetizers. I also feel like the prices are a little high for a resturant in the mall... BUT like I said food was good and so was our server Rolando!! Rolando you are awesome!
This is the BEST place we ever had the pleasure to go to. The customer service is phenomenal! The food is amazing! Olivia's, please come to the East Coast!!

Pleasantly surprised! Fantastic authentic Mexican cuisine and 5 star service from Rolando. I had the Wagyu Skirt Steak it was cooked perfectly and the seasoning really added to the flavor, we will be coming back!
Food isreally good a latin fusion menu and the prices are great the dishes are fillin

Was a big fan about six months ago but apparently Olivia's has gone through management 3xs already since my return. Lots of hired help but no one is paying attention to the customers. Ordered a Bloody Mary that was filled with almost a full glass of ice and clearly not what's pictured in past pictures. Sat at the bar for HH in which the only thing that was good was the fresh chips and salsa. We ordered the Calamari which came out burnt. The chicken taquitos were burnt, when the waitress asked how was everything I mentioned that the chicken taquitos were burnt, she replied with It's to each of its own. Wow really????? I must say that I will never eat here again. You have your other waitress who keeps telling you it's her 3rd day and everyone else who doesn't really care that your customers are in need to order drink, plate and silverware. To be told that the cooks are new then they shouldn't be cooking the food. Our beef taquitos are burnt on the outside ends and not cooked as shown in pic, kinda gross if you ask me.
Poor service they are friendly but took over 10min to take our order. Food was not good either I will never go back

service was the best.. but there food not so impress. they try to hard to be upscale restaurant. small portions, now worth a penny. i would to another restaurant. never coming back again. feel sorry for the staff they were amazing..

Came here as part of a wine and canvas event.

The happy hour prices were great,  the chicken nachos not so much.  The presentation looked like they just dumped everything on top not to mention they burned the chips and the beans.  It seemed like chef was irritated he had to make food so late but it i only seen two waitresses and they were swamped so ordering and waiting for our food took an hour.  We wanted our nachoes while we painted not 15 min before the end so that was a huge let down. 

Pros: waitress was friendly and it's a nice pave inside the Boulevard.

However i won't be ordering food from here anymore unless I'm at another painting event and feel like giving it a 2nd chance.

We found Olivia's by searching for a Mexican restaurant close to our motel in Las Vegas. We were pleasantly surprised with the atmosphere, friendly service, live music, and flavorful dishes. The salsa served with tortilla chips was not your run of the mill
"Pace Picante Sauce" served everywhere but has a unique flavor. Not hot, but nice fresh flavors. Crab and avocado crab cake appetizer disappeared. Chicken and mango ensalada and marinated skirt steak with chimichurri topped off the night. You can tell the folks working here really care about their customer's.

I eat out about 5 times a week at different restaurants and never have I been disappointed by everything from a restaurant.  The service was poor. Plenty of wait staff and a manager on duty. Our $15 steak salad came without dressing, grilled vegetables and was small. I ordered a glass of wine from their menu (they did not have it) so I ordered a midori margarita, it was green but tasted only like lemonade. I would not recommend or return.
I had the cerviche, & steak tacos, my daughter had the pork tacos. Have to tell u it's a spot u want 2 try. The food is good.

Absolutely amazing and beautifully presented food. The atmosphere is chic and modern. All of the staff, especially Rolando was great and very attentive to detail. He made the great suggestion for me to order the Tuna Ceviche, which was the best I've ever had. The live music was the cherry on top. I will definitely be back soon.

Our first dining experience at Olivia's, and it was fantastic!!! Our server Ozzie was awesome, and the fish tacos and paella were amazing. We live in southern highlands, but this was well worth the trek, and we will do it again!

Great food, great atmosphere! They have their very own world renown Chef Jose serving up out of this world, not your normal everyday Latin Cuisine. Host Rolando, was very helpful, and the Beer was cold! The Mall is very clean, and renovated. Keep your eyes open on this place, it's coming up!
Great food, great staff with modern chic Mexican style. Manager is very friendly and accommodating. One of my favorite Mexican spots in valley. The chile relleno is amazing!!!

My family is raving about this restaurant, they said the guacamole is the best! I thought the salsa was fair, and the chicken fajitas also, but they disagreed. The rice was amazing, and the pinto beans were way better than the black beans. Ask for the Pintos! Wow they were bursting with flavor

One of my new favorite Mexican restaurants. The food here is delicious. Their burritto's are amazing and decently priced! I've had a few items on the menu and they were all awesome. My friends said the same thing about their dishes.

Outstanding food and service.  An off the strip gem.   I brought some colleagues over for a business dinner.  The guacamole was fresh and a perfect texture.   I liked the salsa as well.  I had the red chilie shrimp and my guests had the fajitas.   The chilie shrimp were spicy but not that hot.  We also ordered the calamari which was a different kind of grilled or pan seared - also very good.  The drinks were always being filled and the staff was super attentive.  We will be back.

Well. Only open 4 months and not known yet. I tried it and liked it very much. Very friendly staff and the good was very flavorful. BUT !  I think a bit pricy for the area. I will return but not make it a weekly visit. Great atmosphere.
The food here is amazing! I will definitely be back! I had the paella and the seafood was cooked perfectly! Fresh, authentic Latin cuisine! This a restaurant worth driving to!!

Conviently located in the Boulevard Mall where there is ample parking. The service is A1 and very cordial. Our party of nine was out celebrating and they accommodated us quite nicely. The food comes in plentiful portions so well worth the money. 9 people ate plenty for less than $100 including tax and gratuity. They even gave us complimentary dessert. Such nice people. The restaurant is super cute for after work gatherings, parties, and events. They offer a full bar. And it's a great for a first date even if you are just doing drinks. The environment is eclectic, modern and festive. And the restaurant is well maintained and clean.

Me and my husband recently moved here so we decided to take a walk in the mall on a monday night came across olivias which we stopped by to have a drink. The decor of this place is absolutely beautfiul and there plating is sexy. Restrooms super clean. (Very important to me) Perfect place for a date. 

They bring out some chips and salsa, and this is the real deal! Real flavor that brought me back home. We ordered guac and tostadas de ceviche de camaron. Both were incredibly delicious. 

Unfortunately for restaurants its not just about the food or just about he service you need to have both or youll lose customers. We would love to be there once a week but definately not for anyone to make us feel uncomfortable. Youre not doing me a favor im bringing you business.

Ive worked in the industry for 10 years. I've served I've managed. I understand servers frustration when you have $1 coronas and happy hour specials all that worries them is tips. But his bad attitude reflects on your establishment. There are many people that would love to be behind the bar, some people forget they're replaceable.

We'd love to go back! You definately need to try this place out hopefully you have a way better bartender then we had.

By far the friendliest, nicest, and upbeat restaurant I've been to so far! Here's the break down...

FOOD
Absolutely delicious! So much flavor and the presentation was astonishing. The portions were just right too! Pricing wasn't bad either. The quality of food is worth it. I wasn't disappointed with any of the things I've tried...from the appetizers to the entrees and of course the desserts!  

SCENE
The vibe in this place is awesome! It's upbeat and friendly. It's a perfect spot for large groups such as family gatherings or a romantic date for two! Other than that, it's comfortable, clean, and classy! 

STAFF
Besides the food, the staff was my next favorite thing about this place. I went with a large group of 8 for dinner and the staff there was very welcoming and inviting! They were so attentive and friendly and made sure that we were ok and satisfied. Rest assured, we were more than satisfied with their service. No matter how many questions we had or how big our orders were, they answered and took them with smiles! Thank you to our server, ROLANDO! He was awesome and provided the best customer service you can ask for. Along with the rest of the staff, they were overall amazing as well! So happy to have encountered a place like this that I would recommend to EVERYONE! I can you honestly say that besides the good food, the staff definitely built and made this place amazing!

 thumbs up !
Best micheladas and food, Alberto did a good job he suggested  me the Mariscada and it was really good, everything was great friendly staff! !!

100% worth the drive from Summerlin.  If you want upscale, deliciousness in a traditional Latin cuisine, hands down the best food in town.  Amazing FRESH ceviche, sweet corn tamale, best chips and salsa in town.  Even the wine selection was fantastic.  Awesome Michelada which is a beer and Bloody Mary mix, with shrimp and cucumber.  Pulled beef brisket was Great.  The restaurant design is very upscale and modern which maybe doesn't appeal to the crowds in this area of town but it really is beautiful and clean.  Having grown up in Vegas during he 90's I definitely miss the old Boulevard Mall and don't care for the new strip mall design but I will come back just for this restaurant.  Wish this place would open up a location in Downtown Summerlin so I wouldn't have to drive so far.

Great place awesome food awesome service our waiter Rolando did an awesome kick ass job he made perfect suggestions and was very friendly. 
Food was underpriced given the quality and the portion sizes. Definitely coming back there are many dishes to try and a nice bar. And they have good music.

I went to Olivia's about 3 weeks ago and the food was fantastic! Amazing! I gushed to my friends about how good the food was. Sadly, when we went on Tuesday, somehow the foods didn't taste the same. Nothing was the same. We were very disapointed and will never go back.

5 stars to maria my server she is so skillfully to take care of her customers, we have a wonderful time in a late happy hour, to the cheff jose luis it was very nice of him to come out and say hello to us !! Food was AWESOME AND SERVICE TOP NOTCH!! To the manager you have lucky to don't get a nasty review from us cause i see you where making a big deal of serve my drinks at 6:45 pm to enjoy the happy hour, my friend be in the customer side when they are RIGHT . Anyways thanks we really enjoy it.

So we went here knowing of the place for a while. We live right across the strees. One of the worst places I've been. The food just sucked.. I mean I'm not a picky eater but even I didn't want to finish it..  every thing on there is over priced, I'm guess it was supposed to me like a up class Mexican restaurant but really it failed. I would rather go to a taco truck

First time here so I wanted to try a staple latin item: a cuban sandwich...being Haitian/Cuban I expected way more, it wasn't cuban bread, more of a mix between hamburger bread and hard french bread, not the traditional cuban press either...pork was dry and not savory, there were no juices dripping down my arm...growing up in Miami and New York, maybe I am expecting too much from Vegas. The restaurant itself is nice very contemporary clean lines, could use more of a latin touch/color paintings etc. besides just latin music. Staff were nice.

Las Vegas is home to a plethora of mediocre Mexican restaurants, but this is definitely NOT one of them!  The food and the service can only be described as upscale, and even though it is more expensive than the local neighborhood, it is definitely worth the price. I had the carne Asada chile Relleno, and it was superb. They roasted the pepper and stuffed it with carne Asada, mushrooms and cheese, but skipped the usual batter and deep frying. This produced a much lighter, yet still hardy dish. The rice and accompanying sauce were excellent as well. 

The chips and salsa were obviously made on site, and the guacamole was some of the best I've ever eaten. I finished the meal with a wonderful flan that I know I'll have on my next visit. 

Service was excellent all around, and it's hard to believe a restaurant this nice is located in the (recently renovated) Boulevard mall. Make the trip; it's definitely worth it.
Went today with my family. The whole staff was very friendly. Our server were Oswaldo & Ruddy fantastic service. Food  & drinks fantastic everything we had was amazing. Definitely will go back.
Worst experience ever!!! Went for Lunch and didn't get what I ordered which was enchiladas... Staff is very careless

I came here back in December of 2016, let me tell you it was an amazing experience! Service was wonderful, manger was friendly, the food and drinks were AMAZING!!!! Wish it was still the same.


So I came back and I believe this place is under new management or something because I can tell you right now its not the same, menu is different, staff is not the same, they don't seem very happy and thats probably due to new management. Its a shame because I really liked the vibe last time, felt it could have been my spot. My advice is if it ain't broke don't fix it. Whoever took over now....what where you thinking?!
I stopped at Olivia's today for lunch.  My sister is in town thought I'd try it.  The food is amazing.  Atmosphere amazing. Most amazing Ruth our server.  I am coming back for happy hour !

Best Vegas Meal (after a week eating at the strip)! The service was amazing, the steak literally melted in my mouth. Delicious salsa and guacamole that rivals my dad's. Such an amazing place!! Will recommend to anyone that visits Vegas to eat here! And the value?? I kept wondering how it was possible for such good food to be so reasonably priced! Oh and dollar coronas and three dollar margaritas (actually good ones with good quality tequila). The place to go!!

Everything was soooo good!! Usually there's at least one item that I don't really care for, but I can honestly say that everything we ordered was executed perfectly!

Awesome start with free home made chips and salsa. Chips weren't too oily and the salsa had just the right heat.

With the calamari appetizer ($10), I had expected typical fried calamari with some kind of dip, but instead we got nicely seared, chipotle seasoned rings and legs on a bed of arugula with citrus dressing.

The fish tacos ($11) were just so delicious, I almost have no words at this point. I have issues with cooked fish 99% of the time. But these tacos were unbelievably moist, flaky, and seasoned just right!

Seared scallop entree ($19) was perfection. Nice smoky flavor, tasty seasoning, and most importantly, plump/fresh scallops.

Amazing food. I've never had better or more authentic Latin food. Make sure to get the berry ceviche and flautas. For the main course I got the carne Asada and it was so tender you could cut it with a fork. It was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.

Que Rico! This place is under new management and they're doing a great job. Working out a few kinks but they'll be top notch soon. They've added some traditional options to the menu and all their seafood dishes are off the charts. Classy, great customer service, fantastic food.

First time here $1 coronas $3 tacos and tornados amazing! The steak tacos I prefer over tacos El Gordo. Our server Rolando was awesome and very caring of my pregnant wife he got freaked out when I said she is due any minute lol. This spot is a big asset to blvd mall. I'm big on customer service and this spot nailed it!!!!!!!

Ps Rolando should get a raise!

Went on a Sunday evening with my husband.  Out waiter was friendly, but did not tell us about happy hour beers so we paid full price for 5 drinks when we would have been even more "happy" with $2 Coronas.  Didn't know until we exited and saw the happy hour sign which was posted at the mall entrance, no sign at the regular entrance.  :(

Food was effortful but not that good.  We had the charbroiled octopus which had good texture but was a little too smoky and salty.  The waiter recommended the 2 for 1 shrimp cocktails, tasty but too much food considering we said we were originally going to split a ceviche.  

By the time the entrees arrived, lengua tacos and paella, we were already very full so we packed most of it to go.  The seafood on the paella was good quality, by charbroiled the same way as the octopus appetizer, so felt like a repeat.  The bed of rice with chorizo under the seafood was good.  Lengua tacos were fine.

There was a singer with a microphone singing Spanish songs the entire hour+ we were there, singing to different tables.  It was super loud and we couldn't have much conversation.  Seemed like too much entertainment for the 4 or 5 tables that were occupied in this large bar and dining space.  He was a good singer but it was just too loud.

The staff chased us down as we were leaving, because we had left sunglasses on the table, so we did really appreciate that.

Husband & I went here cause I was craving enchiladas & it was on the way home. Kinda didn't want to go, Boulevard Mall. Well I'm glad we did. First the chips & salsa excellent. Chips  homemade, seasoned.  Salsa has great combination of spices that gives it a good bite. And my enchiladas were seasoned, with I don't know what,  but they didn't need any salsa on them!  And our waiter Rolando was awesome. This is a great Mexican/Latino fusion restaurant, will definitely go again!
Great service and upscale dinning... The calamari is awesome and the cuban torta... The seafood paella hits the spot with a kick

This place is amazing - honestly too good for The Boulevard Mall- but I'm grateful that it's there because I live nearby. 

Everything that I've had there has been delicious and unique. The enchiladas were amazing, but smaller than I'm used to. I honestly believe that they're made that way intentionally to have more control over the flavor profile. 

They also have great drink specials. A great afternoon starts with some cocktails across the street at Champagne's, followed by a trip here for some more drinks and delicious food. 

There are also a lot of seafood options that I haven't tried yet, but am excited to eventually try. It seems like a higher end place when you go in, but don't let that discourage you. There are lots of reasonably priced and delicious options. 

All in all, I definitely recommend this place.
This place is a hidden gem. Great happy hour and exceptional service. I will be back most definitely.
Grilled octopus was great. Salsa and steal tacos were good too. They had a nice happy hour, but we weren't drinking. Can't wait to go back and try the paella.

I took my hubby here for dinner on a suggestion from a client, this is the best Mexican food I've ever had here in Las Vegas!! And it's right in my own neighborhood.... Everything is made to order (except the delicious rice and beans) so it takes a little longer, well worth the wait!! And they have live entertainment on Saturday nights, which is a bonus! The place is shiny clean, comfortable, everyone is super friendly..... Rolando is the best waiter!! I would definitely recommend to anyone and we will definitely be back!!

It doesn't even make sense how good this food is! This place belongs in some fancy hotel with how delicious it is. Everything that comes out of that kitchen is full of flavor. We were visiting from out of town and I can't wait to come back to eat here again.

LEGIT-
Place was empty but we decided to try it anyway since it was close to the house. Had the octopus and a chile rellano for starters. Both were delicious. For entree our server Carlos suggested the wagu skirt steak. Unbelievable!! Great flavor. Dessert we had the rice pudding and Carlos brought us some churros to try. The entire meal including service was excellent.Both me and the wife are in the business and work in an upscale dining place in Caesars and thought the food here was great. Can't wait to go back. Thanks again to Carlos!!

So disappointed. I was excited about trying this latin cuisine, and now i wish i hadn't.  The margaritas are ridiculous small for $8. The beans are bland and taste just like the no salt can beans.  They got our order all wrong too and had to wait for them to remake it. Also, there were ants in the floor and got bit by one of them. I asked to speak to the manager and came and say, maybe you want to move, and that was it. Horrible, horrible, horrible!!!!i should of known that this place was horrible when i did not see any people here.

The best service I've had in years! Rolando and all of the staff were magnificent. Chef Jose even came to our table to meet us because we ordered a second round of grilled fish tacos!! We felt like royalty. The food is authentic and fresh! My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas and I've lived here for 30 years!

This restaurant is the best I had lunch there and the food drinks and service was excellent I fell in love with there salsa and bean dip the atmosphere was on hit and the media screens where a blast. I will return on saturday and have one of there margaritas they are famous for I recommend this restaurant to any one that love authentic Mexican food. I love love the place seriously. Olivia is clean  from the kitchen to the rest rooms.  See you Saturday.

Juan was way better than our server, the food was very delicious.  They definitely need to train the server to be more attentive.  Georgio the right hand man of the owner made everything right.  Ozzy we think was our server needs better training.  For such a nice place I would recommend you get better servers.  Maria was actually our server,  she needs more training!!!!

My first experience at Olivia's was definitely my last. Although I was not impressed by the Americanized Mexican food, I enjoyed the customer service that our pleasant server provided. 

However, the treatment my husband and I received from management after we discovered that our debit card was not returned to us was a complete deal breaker. Instead of the manager making the effort to look for our debit card, he insisted that it wasn't there. It was only after we continued to persist that they check their books that they finally looked for it and found it. That was by far the worst customer service we've ever received at a restaurant.

This is the most under rated restaurant in VEGAS! The tortilla chips are the best here. You add the guacamole and I'm in heaven. I also like the house salsa very much. The Yuca fries are a must get here as well. Add the flautas and you have a meal for two that won't break the bank.

HAPPY HOUR!$4 micheladas $3 dos xx
Our server was ROLANDO he was amazing he recommended our dishes! Both were seafood dishes! AMAZING!! And I hate seafood but he didn't take no for an answer so he brought me a sample of the Ahi Tuna It was delicious!! That's real service for you!! Ask for ROLANDO!!

I'm a big fan of the shrimp taco! Has to be battered with the great toppings to finish it off ( sour cream, cabbage, marinated onions) you get the idea! Pretty much an Ensenada Style Shrimp/Fish Taco! Well I don't have the best of luck finding one here in Las Vegas until we were doing some shopping at the Boulevard Mall! I saw the construction going on a year or 2 back and noticed they were going to open up a Mariscos Restaurant! Gotta admit they did a hell of job with the interior decor, looks might fancy! Well finally tried it today and did not regret it one bit!! We will definitely be coming back to try some of their other specialty dishes!

We were so excited for this place to open and checked on it a few times but it wasn't open yet and finally this time when we went there and it was open!  We are so glad we went there... the street corn was amazing and the pulled pork brisket flautas were so good and my husband had the carnitas tacos and they were amazing.... the meat was cooked perfectly and they put cojita cheese on everything it was just delicious even the rice and beans were good.. the service was impeccable and even down to filling your water glass was perfect... we live down the street and we'll go back time and time again I'm sure

No es la primera  vez en este lugar ,les cuento que el guacamole fresco con chips  que delicia ,pulpo a la brasa un poco picante pero muy rico,camarones zarandeados deliciosos ,el ambiente muy  acogedor Atención muy buena Ruth  es muy amable claro q seguiremos viniendo

I know what you're thinking.  Mexican food at the Boulevard Mall... The Boulevard Mall???  But really, I don't give out four-star for nothing, so it may be worthwhile to go and here's why. 

First thing first, it has its own entrance from the outside to the restaurant.  That's always been one of my major concerns - what if the mall closes before I leave the restaurant...  I don't want to spend the night at any malls, let alone the Boulevard's.  

They also have an "outside" patio that's actually al fresco to the inside of the mall.  So, yes, you can people watch or be watched by the mall-goers.  Either way, it's awkward fun. 

And then there's the food.  It's a modern take on Mexican food that's not offensive.  I personally think most fusion or modern food is unnecessary and culturally offensive.  However, Olivia's straddles the fine line between creativity and preserving each dish's element of essential flavors.  

This is what I remember what we had that was good: steak tartare pizza, calamari and scallops.  Our server asked if we wanted any dessert and we declined.  A couple minutes later, he returned with a mango mousse - compliment of the house.  It was good and refreshing.  

We tried other dishes too but I cannot recall what they were anymore.  Old age may be to blame or the delicious margarita I had at Olivia's that's currently on my mind.  Either way, I intend to refresh my memory by going to Olivia's again.

I came here when they first opened and have been a few times since. I love there happy hour! It's super inexpensive and delicious. The drinks are good and cheap too. My fav is the chicken quesadilla. I love that they offer chips and salsa in the beginning. Las night me and my hubby came here and it took longer then usual for our food to come out. One server apologized and offered us more chips with guacamole which was nice of him. Another server messed up on our bill and over charged us for more tacos she corrected it and let us take the extra tacos homes. The customer service here is awesome.

Just finished my Birthday lunch here .. we stumbled upon this while shopping at boulevard and I saw decent reviews so since we were Downey Sunrise I decided why not try this out for lunch ..

Let me just say I'm shocked how good it actually is from the moment we were seated it was on point ..

Initially we were helped by Oz who recommended a Avocado Margarita to me and was super friendly with a smile ..

After which Rudy greeted us and brought our drinks and kept out tables filled with drinks and chips and a friendly smile ..

Our server ended up being Rolando and he was attentive and helpful and very friendly..

Now when it comes to the food we got 

Table Guac which was really good for the $7 cost 

For our entrees we got one Torta Blvd with sweet potato fries and omg it was delicious

I opted for six oysters be a ensalasa de casa which was delicious

The Avocado Margarita was decent but the cucumber Margarita was so freaking delicious definitely recommend it

It seems like happy hour is best time to come and they are doing a valentines special too so definitely check this place out !!

Too bad the location is in the Blvd 
Doesn't stop me from coming though 
Bombbbbbb food and drinks 
Nice ambiance and great service!

Some of the sitting area is to dark to see the food you eat. The fajitas were not fresh and cut to small. The consumer has a hard time finding the meat in the dark. The rice was warm and the tortillas were not even warm. The pico de gallo was very weak. Sorry I call it as it is.

We came here on Saturday with a large group of friends. I made a reservation, but I didn't need to as it was dead.

This is a newer place and it's kind of in an odd location. Hopefully for them, they'll survive due to the food. 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars: They only have 1 type of tequila. It isn't very good and it comes with a nice little hangover the next day. So beware. 

We ordered the guacamole--it was super good. Nice and full of avacado chunks. 
Shrimp and fish tacos -- I didn't have any, but my fiance said they were delicious. 
I ordered the Waygu beef steak. It doesn't come with tortillas, which it should. But I did order flour tortillas as a side. Mine was almost cold...but everyone else said their food was hot.
The steak itself was really good and cooked how I asked. It wasn't as tender as Waygu noramlly is. And it was a little overpowered by the cumin. So that was nice to taste the rest of the night. :| 

Everyone else loved their dishes. We did have someone order shrimp enchiladas, but it was chicken. They did comp her dish. 

Our waiters were super friendly, and very attentive. They were quick to refill all of our drinks, and the dishes all came out in a very timely manner. 

I would love to go back and try some more dishes. I just doubt it'll be any time soon so we live way up in the NW. But I hope it continues to do well!

We were searching for a decent Mexican meal while vacationing in town.  We saw good reviews on Yelp and decided to give it a try.   They started our meal with chips and salsa.  Now if all you've ever had is the standard salsa from mediocre run of the mill restaurants, then you might not like this salsa.  It was totally different than anything I've tasted.  The chips were also something different, more like fresh tortillas fried and seasoned.  I found I liked them alone, even without salsa.  I had a chicken burrito with tomatillo sauce and it was absolutely wonderful.  The chicken was seasoned well and had a wonderful smoked flavor.  Hubby had the fajita's .   Our server, Ruth was fantastic.  We had management stop by a couple of times to make sure our food was great.  We absolutely loved this place and would highly recommend it!
This place is so nice and the food is delicious! Everything I've eaten there was great!!! Repeat customer.....

Came here for the first time with my husband and we both loved it! The tacos and enchiladas are the best! Thank you Rolando and Treasure for the amazing food and great customer service! We will definitely come back!

My boyfriend and I are always looking for new places to try and Olivia's did not disappoint. From the beginning we were so impressed with the appearance of the restaurant and the attention we were given from the start. The food was amazing to say the least; he had a Cuban torta and I had the chicken burrito. We also ordered some drinks, a margarita and some preparadas and the drinks were just as great as the food, not too strong and just the right taste. We are so glad we came here and are looking forward to coming again in the near future.

I loved the waiter their the most she was so kind! I'm vegetarian so she offered to make some changes to some of the items on the happy hour menu! Everything was delicious, especially the $4 margaritas (:

They have spent alot to establish this restaurant; just not sure the venue will work based on menu prices.  That being said ... food was fantastic! Everything we tried was excellent.  The service, let's just say that our waiter was having a very rough night.

Don't come here unless you want to be ripped off!!!! We have been here many times before and THIS TIME they raised the prices and it does not reflect on the menu! Horrible service and they wouldn't do anything about it. We bring 10-15 people every time and spend a bunch of money. We will NEVER be coming back again. The new management is shady!! Do not eat here ever!!!!

The food was good and our waiter was great but he had so many tables and he was running around like crazy trying to keep everybody happy. It was a shame to see the manager walk up to him to tell him to bend over and pick up a napkin while he was so busy when that manager could have bent over himself! The staff all seems afraid and stressed out which stressed us out! They were really doing a good job but the manager was just walking around with a negative attitude and it really affected our experience in a bad way. Don't want to go back to a place where employees look scared at work! Fear management is a horrible thing to experience.

Absolutely Delicious Seafood Paella!!! Our server, Rolando was very attentive and gracious. This was a great Latin Fusion Restaurant with a Modern Ambience. The price is really good for the food quality
Went back and had some wonderful food. Staff was great. Note that I sat with the tables, not at the bar, not that I knew anyone at the bar. Much better experience... and the food was really good!!!
The atmosphere was nice and I was happy with the wait staff but the food was tasteless and not well cooked. Was hoping for a better experience  but was sadly disappointed.
Food is good scallops really good actually little to spice for my self but good rice n presentation, Mango mousse amazing... Amazing service the beautiful service nice n cool, love atmosphere...

Came in on Sunday afternoon, can't go wrong with $2.00 Coronas!!

This restaurant is in a really nice, large space.  Can easily have an office holiday party here.  Great bar area, with big screen tvs throughout the restaurant

Rolando was our waiter & was amazing! He & his busser were on point throughout our whole meal!

I could not have asked for better Latin food:

Grilled Calamari - I will never eat calamari another way again, grilled to perfection
Shrimp Nachos - Nachos are my one of my favorite foods & Olivia's does them right
Tuna Ceviche - Beautiful presentation & flavor

We would not have changed a single thing about our meal.  Jose Marquez, chef, came out to greet us & we could not stop gushing over the yummy meal!

I've been craving their food every since, can't wait to go back!!

I always judge a by the first thing they bring out. Whether it be the bread dish or chips. I knew the food would be good once I tried the chips and salsa. I had the campechana (shrimp cocktail) and it had the perfect flavors. I didn't have to add anything to it. I will definitely be coming back!
Great authentic food with nice atmosphere and awesome Ahi Tuna Ceviche. Very friendly and quick staff. I would definitely recommend and will going back.
This fabulous new restaurant just opened Sunday as part of the Boulevard Mall revitalization. The chili relleno stuffed with carne asada -riquisímo!

Food was good service was great!! Rolando the bartender was great!! Good service! The manager was very welcoming. I was thinking about eating there and the greeting made my mind up for me. Wasn't pressure but more like your welcome to stay and eat. Good energy here I recommend eating here.

So my wife got a $20 gift cert. for this restaurant last December and we finally decided to check it out. Guess what, this place is no longer in business. We tried calling their number n found out that is no longer in service, we drove by it and found the doors locked. So, too bad we never got to use our gift cert.

nice place love the decor real modern mexican join with centroamerica items .
i just went for a beer the price was 2 dollars  more than i was toll but the give some ships and a really chonky  super amazing salsa the bartender was very nice to be honest I just when there for the name Olivia's yeah the one on Law & Order.
lol

Olivia's is a hidden gem!  Don't let the mall location fool you - great food, great mojitos, and a nice, clean, modern ambiance, plus a valet parking option.  Very tasty chips, salsa and guacamole to start, were followed by a superb chipotle calamari that was sautéed, not fried. So good!

The paella was out of this world, with shrimp, scallops, mussels, calamari and fish (white bass) over a delicious spicy rice base.  Truly excellent!  Fish tacos with the same white bass were great, too.

The service was impeccable; very friendly and really helpful with recommendations from the extensive menu.  We'll definitely be back next week!

For $14 I expected a bigger portion. I ordered a corn tamale and a tortilla soup. The soup didn't taste well. The tamale was delicious. I expected more. The cup was so big and to see that there was barely  any soup inside was disappointing. If it would have tasted amazing I would have been ok with the small portion. But it tasted burnt and not smoky. Not a fan of this :(
Best food iv had in Las Vegas hands down!!!! and let me say this .. You Must Order the "Passion fruit mousse"!!! you will thank me later ! i found them at the blvd mall. check em out!

I don't understand all of the 5-star reviews on this place. Maybe it's just the service? Maybe they're just pleasantly surprised to find a semi-ok place in a practically defunct mall? Maybe this was just an off-day for the chef? Maybe I'll never know.

Ambiance: They made the place look pretty nice! You almost forget you're in a mall.

Service: Definitely friendly enough and timely enough, except the secondary server / busboy was wearing so much cologne we assumed he'd bathed in it and expected him to give us a sales pitch for it. It literally -- and I'm using that word as it's intended, not in a figurative way -- stung our nostrils every time he came by to refill our waters. That's a huge turnoff when people are trying to eat/smell/taste things. I can't believe the mangers let him work like that. Our actual waiter didn't have the same problem. Also, just like a couple other Mexican places around town, be prepared for multiple people to try to get you to order their guacamole. I love guac, but I hate up-selling.

Food: The free chips & salsa at the beginning are pretty decent. The chips will remind you of Mundo, if you ever went there. The salsa is a tad on the bitter/fire-roasted side, so if you like that style, you'll really dig it. Not very spicy st all. We ordered the calamari and the carne asada chile relleno. Calamari is grilled, FYI - not sure if we just didn't see that or it didn't say. It had a good flavor, but included way less for the money than most similar offerings, so don't expect to get a whole plate of it. For $10, you get maybe 8-10 small pieces and some salad. The chile relleno was a let down, especially since it's listed as a "fan favorite" on their site. It's basically meat, potatoes, mushrooms, rice, & beans in a large green chili with red sauce & a bit of cream. The meat was ok, but not as flavorful as I expect carne asada to be. The biggest issue with it was that the potatoes were not cooked all the way through; we ended up not being able to eat many of them. The red sauce it was bathed in was very odd, way too bitter & smoky for our taste (so take their salsa, which was good, and turn up the bitterness & smokiness until it's obnoxious, and that's how the sauce seemed). That could just be us, though, even though he usually really enjoys smoky sauces.

NOTES: You should know that the happy hour just changed (today, apparently) and is now 7-10pm instead of 5-7. My loss, your gain! Also, don't get your hopes up for sangria, cause it's not (at least not currently) on the menu.

Though I certainly appreciate friendly service, it doesn't outweigh the taste of your food (and the under-cooked-ness of it), especially when it's supposed to be a house special of sorts. I plan to come back and try a couple other things and will update this review if those things warrant an extra star.
Good food and a great happy hour - its in a mall that has a bad rep but more people need to check this place out!
